result.execSummary:
The defendant Marco T Alvarado was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 9:56am [mo]
Defendant Marco T Alvarado in court with attorney Michael C. Witt.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

The State moves to strike the word "violent" from the charging language in Count #2
--The Court grants the State leave to strike to word violent from the charging language in Count #2

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Amended Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State and Joint Recommendation of the Parties, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1

On Amended Count #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:

--maintain absolute sobriety
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--assessment is to be within 60 days
--to undergo amy other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--enroll in and complete Certified Batterer's treatment, if recommended by DOC
--no acts or threats of violence
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay $100 domestic abuse surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  0 days
The Court orders that cash bond be applied to costs/fees
recess: 10:20am

Motion hearing at 09-29-2015 03:00 pm

[MK] case called at 11:17am. 
Attorney Michael C. Witt in court.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Today's Oral Ruling is on the State's Motion for In-Camera Inspection and Disclosure. 
The Court indicates that it has conducted the in-camera inspection and now concludes that the materials that were submitted to the Court for review should be disclosed in their entirety to the Defense because they call into question voracity. The Court is satisfied as to the propriety of discovery in regard to these materials. 
The Court will sign a written order that Attorney Witt can discuss the information with the Defendant for purposes of making stategic and tactical decisions, but otherwise the materials are not to be disclosed further. If Attorney Witt seeks any other disclosure, such as to a defense investigator, he would need to submit a basis for the materials being provided and a proposed, separate order for this. Further the Court directs that, at the conclusion of the case, these documents are to be returned by counsel to the Court. 
The Court will keep under seal the investigative reports that were tendered to the Court for context-purposes. 
The Court has the clerk copy and then provide to the attorneys the designated materials.  The Court instructs the clerk to then re-seal the materials in the case file.
recess 11:24am. (to allow time for the attorneys to review the newly-received materials).
reconvene 11:31am. 
Attorney Witt indicates that he anticipates that he will be fling motions regarding the admissibility of any testimoney related to the disclosure, admissibility of/propriety of the existence or non-existence of great bodily harm; and then, based on the ruling outcome on those motions, he may pursue --if in fact Mr. Alvardo's injuries did cause great bodily harm, then a selective prosecution challenge. 
The Court requres the filing of these motions, along with any motions in limine or any pretrial admissibility motions by 7/30/15.
The Court further directs that unless a party agrees with the motion, then a written response is to be filed no later than 9/4/15 at 4:00pm. 
recess 11:38am. 

NEXT:   Motion Hearing on 9/11/15 at 8:30am (allow 1 to 1 1/2 hours)
Oral ruling at 07-09-2015 11:15 am
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 1:02 pm [Clerk SH] (On State's 5.22.15 Motion for In-Camera Inspection)
Defendant Marco T Alvarado in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin, along with City of Lake Mills Attorney, Steve Zach.
ADA Beck informs the Court that they have provided officer with copy of motion/brief and notice of today's hearing. Officer does not intend to appear at today's hearing. 
Court finds on this record that former Officer has had notice and his interests in the Court's view have been protected
Counsel have no objection to Mr. Zach making appearance today
Atty Zach confirms that he has recieved copies of all State/Defense materials; informs the Court that they have segregated small portion of personnel file for the Court's review. Propose providing documents for in-camera review and that those documents would be sealed in the Court file. Would like some consideration of non-disclosure until Court makes decision on whether or not records are admissible in this matter. If documents are admissible, become open record at that time. 
Atty Witt and ADA Beck agree to proposal by Atty Zach

Court grants State's motion for in-camera inspection; Court orders Clerk to seal all documents when submitted to the Court, including investigative reports. 
ADA Beck provides the Court with investigative reports
off-record: 1:15 - 1:20 pm for Clerk to make copies for parties
ADA Beck submits personnel documents to the Court; Atty Witt confirms there is not a speedy trial demand
off-record: 1:24 - 1:28 pm for scheduling 
Clerk announces date for the record; Court confirms that State does not need to provide notice to officer of oral ruling
Recess: 1:29 pm

case called at 10:10am. [MK]
Attorney Michael C. Witt in court (Authorization filed) .  ADA John Fryatt appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Witt verifies that the Defendant's date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived
Defense stands mute. The Court enters pleas of "not guilty".  The Defense waives speedy trial.

The Court continues the $500 cash bond (already posted), with added conditions: 
--not to commit any acts or threats of violence
--no discussion of this case with Andrea Soto
--to maintain absolute sobriety: no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, package houses
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking by 4:30pm on 2/6/15
--to report to the Clerk of Courts Office to sign this Amended Bond by 4:30pm on 2/6/15.
The Court informs the parties that this case is assigned to Judge Wambach, Branch III. 
recess 10:12am. 


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on  2/18/15 at 10:00am  (2)  Status Conference on 3/31/15 at 9:00am.
